answers.answer: I would be more concerned if you had high blood pressure. It sounds like they said and is just a lot of water weight which is quite common at the end of pregnancy.  Let them keep an eye on your blood pressure and you need to keep an eye out for headaches, blurred vision etc.     Good Luck

Did they do a urine test at all? I wouldnt worry too much if your BP is good, but if you are still worried, have them take a urine sample. Extra proteins and stuff in the urine could tip them off also.What has your BP been like throughout your pg? Even though the number is within normal range, if it is elevated for you specifically, then that is an indication also. Good luck.

NEVER HAS BEEN HIGH EVER IN MY LIFE EVEN THRU PREGNANCY.  OH YES THEY DO A URINE TEST EVERY TIME I GO.  SO YESTERDAY THEY DID URINE.  SO BP GOOD AND URINE GOOD.  ONLY PROB IS SWELLING.  IT IS LIKE 100 DEGREES HERE WHICH PLAYS A BIG PART I KNOW BUT WHEN IT COMES TO OUR LITTLE ONES IT IS SO HARD NOT TO WORRY.  I STAY INSIDE.  TOO HOT FOR ME.

My doc is watchign me for preclampsia i took a 24 hour urine test. my symptoms are slight swelling and high blood pressure. last time they checked my blood pressure it was 124/80 but my norm IS 110/70 AND SOMETIMES 110/60. and when I checked my blood pressure on my own this morning it was 136/81 but my temp is normal my temp is 97.5.  so i say try to calm down (even though it hard) and trust in the doctor. it might just be water weight, and the swelling going down is a good thing! keep us posted!
well i went in today...two days after gaining 6lbs in 6 days and I have lost 2 1/2lbs.  Of the water weight.  Doc says as long as bp is not up there really is not concern.  It is just the weather.

Hello! I am glad that your swelling and weight gain have gone down a little (for your sanity)  The great news is that preecclampsia is cured by delivery.  I know of women who have had to delivery babies VERY early because of pre-ecc.  However, since you are 38 weeks IF the doctors felt you needed to deliver, your baby would be very healthy.Just trying to look on the bright side.  :)  It sounds like everything is wonderful now.  Wishing you a happy and pain-free delivery! (haha)Amy

question: I am 38 weeks pg and I had my weekly visit yesterday.  My doc was unavailble due to delivery so I was told I would see the nurse practioner.  The nurse took me in and weighed me.  I had gained 6lbs in 6 days.  I was freaking out and so was the nurse alittle.  She said you are retaining so much water.  So I waited for the nurse practioner to do my exam.  By the time she came in my husband had called my cell and I was crying I was so worried.  My blood pressure was good 120/70.  The nurse practioner said she was sure it was water weight and not to worry.  She stated they would watch for preeclampsia.  So she is having me come back on friday just to check my blood pressure and in the mean time just watch my salt.  Well so I go home and just get on the net and start reading up on it.  Only symptoms I have are the swelling.  My hands and feet only really.  However every morning I wake up and have been waking up with a swollen face which goes down in an half hour or so.  Mostly just my lips.  That again is another sign.  The more I read the more I am going crazy.  I guess I was just looking for alittle bit of comfort to ease my mind.  I mean I read about it but I never find any real answers.  Do I have to worry about preeclampsia if I do not have high blood pressure?
title: Preeclampsia????
